comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Wilfrid Ward, the staunchly Roman Catholic editor of the Dublin Review, late in 1913 was on a speaking tour of the United States. The tour may still have been in progress in January, 1914, when the Bain News Agency circulated this photograph to its subscribers. At his December 5, 1913, lecture in New York City (attended by prominent Catholics, including Cardinal John Farley of New York), Ward spoke in praise of the late British scholar and Cardinal, John Henry Newman. Report in the New York Times, December 6, 1913: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=980CEFD61E3BE633A...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Wilfrid Ward's daughter, Maisie, married an Australian, Frank Sheed, and in 1926 they founded the now well-known British Catholic publishing house of Sheed & Ward, which has a branch in the U. S. www.jstor.org/pss/25154864

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The celebrated author Wilfrid Sheed is the son of Frank and Maisie, and the grandson of Wilfrid Ward. Among his numerous published volumes is a biography of his parents. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilfrid_Sheed
